item.title: Six Exercises To Prep You For the Paddleboard
item.description:
Six Exercises To Prep You For the Paddleboard

With the ability to burn up to 800 calories in one hour, it's no wonder stand up paddleboarding (SUP) has skyrocketed in popularity. "A few years ago, there were only five to 10 SUP races, and now there are hundreds of events," says J.J.

item.title: Brody Welte Named Head Coach For USA SUP/Paddleboard Team
item.description:
Brody Welte Named Head Coach For USA SUP/Paddleboard Team

Effective immediately, the executive director of Surfing America, Greg Cruse announced the new 2016 Coaches for the USA SUP/Paddleboard team and key addition to Surfing America Board of Directors.

item.title: Three Common Mistakes
item.description:
Three Common Mistakes

When I was in high school I did a lot of ski racing and was fortunate to have some very good coaches work with me. One of the things that always intrigued me was how the right combination of words could have a profound effect on a person's understanding and visualization of a desired movement.

item.title: How to SUP with your dog. Summer is star...
item.description:
How to SUP with your dog. Summer is star...

How to SUP with your dog. Summer is starting. We decided to teach our beloved Golden Retriever Happy how to stand up paddle with us. Wondering how to turn your dog into a stand up paddle lover? Here are the steps we followed: 1/ In the garden (2 weeks) - Introduce the board to your dog.

item.title: SUP Basics - What should my SUP paddle length be? | SUPboarder Mag
item.description:
SUP Basics - What should my SUP paddle length be? | SUPboarder Mag

What should my SUP paddle length be? The most commonly asked question SUP. Well it really comes down to personal preference, but is also influenced by what you're doing on your SUP. To get you started here is the SUPboarder basic guide to paddle length.

item.title: SUP Women | Roxy Davis | SUP Magazine
item.description:
SUP Women | Roxy Davis | SUP Magazine

Taking up standup paddling primarily to fulfill her thirst for water time when surf wasn't up to par, South Africa's national surf champion, Roxy Davis, fell in love with SUP not long after stepping aboard. Davis' romance with the sport allowed her to take on new titles in another realm of wave-riding.

item.title: World of Sunfish
item.description:
World of Sunfish

No matter what your skill level, gender, or age, the World of Sunfish has something for you. Sail, paddle, race, relax - It's easier than ever to get out on the water with Sunfish. Check it out: www.worldofsunfish.com

item.title: How to Perform a Buoy Turn with Kenny Kaneko
item.description:
How to Perform a Buoy Turn with Kenny Kaneko

Performing a buoy turn is one of the requisite skills all SUP paddlers seek to accomplish once they become comfortable on their boards. In this How To video, SIC Global Athlete Kenny Kaneko demystifies the maneuver by breaking down a buoy turn into a series of easy to follow steps which will give you the skills and insights to efficiently execute buoy turns with precision and style.

item.title: Stand Up Paddleboard Yoga: 4 Poses to Try
item.description:
Stand Up Paddleboard Yoga: 4 Poses to Try

It's early in her morning practice when Gillian Gibree takes a familiar asana: Adho Mukha Svanasana (Downward-Facing Dog Pose). To start waking up her arms and legs, she presses evenly through her hands and feet. She lifts her sitting bones skyward as she relaxes her neck and finds extension in her long spine.
